Special Abilities:

  • Claws: A hit with this attack causes Energy Drain (Vigor). A Vigor roll (at –2 with a raise on the attack) resists this effect.
  • Darkvision: Spectres ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Flight: Pace 10.
  • Infection: Anyone slain by a claw attack raises as a spectre 1d4 rounds later.
  • Incorporeal: Shadows can become invisible and immaterial at will and can only be harmed by magical weapons or attacks.
  • Invulnerability: Spectres take no damage from non-magical attacks.
  • Resilient: Spectres can take one Wound before they’re Incapacitated.
  • Unnatural Aura: Animals, wild or domesticated, can sense the unnatural presence of a spectre at a distance of 10 yards. They will not willingly get closer unless persuaded. As long as an animal is within 10 yards of a spectre, it is Distracted.
  • Weakness (Daylight): Spectres flee from direct sunlight. While exposed to it, they cannot attack and are Vulnerable.

Languages: Common.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.text:
Swarm

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Swarm]{Link to Actor}

Sometimes the most deadly foes come in the smallest packages. The swarm described here can consist of most anything—from biting ants to stinging wasps to filthy rats. They cover an area equal to a Large, Medium, or Small @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Blast Template} and attack everyone within it every round. When a swarm is Incapacitated it’s effectively dispersed.

Swarms aren’t intelligent enough to do anything but move and bite and shouldn’t take Multi-Actions, make Tests, etc.

Type: Neutral Animal or Vermin (Swarm)

Attributes: Agility d10, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d12, Strength d8, Vigor d10

Skills: Notice d6

Pace: 10; Parry: 4; Toughness: 7

Special Abilities:

  • Bite or Sting: Swarms inflict hundreds of tiny bites or stings every round, hitting automatically (unless Shaken) and causing 2d4 damage to everyone in the template at the end of their turn. Damage is applied to the least armored location (victims in completely sealed suits are immune).
  • Split: Some swarms split into two smaller swarms when Wounded (GM’s call). Reduce the Blast Template one size after a Wound; Small swarms are destroyed.
  • Swarm: +2 to recover from being Shaken, Parry +2. Swarms are composed of many small creatures, so cutting and piercing weapons do no real damage. Area effect weapons work normally, and a character can stomp to inflict his damage in Strength each round. Some swarms (bees, hornets, birds) may be foiled by total immersion in water.

Wild Card Tarrasque

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Tarrasque]{Link to Actor}

The legendary tarrasque is among Golarion’s most destructive monsters. Thankfully, it spends most of its time in a deep torpor in an unknown cavern in a remote corner of the world. Yet when it wakens, kingdoms perish.

Although far from intelligent, the tarrasque is smart enough to understand a few words in Aklo. Likewise, it isn’t mindless in its rampages, but instead focuses on targets that threaten it. The tarrasque is difficult to distract with trickery.

Type: Neutral Magical Beast (Tarrasque)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d6, Spirit d12, Strength d12+7, Vigor d12+4

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d12+2, Notice d12+4

Pace: 7; Parry: 9; Toughness: 29 (6)

Edges: Arcane Resistance (Imp), Combat Reflexes, Counterattack, Frenzy, Nerves of Steel, Strong Willed, Sweep (Imp)

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +6 (Heavy Armor): Super-dense carapace.
  • Bite/Claws/Horns: Str+d8, AP 4, Reach 2.
  • Carapace: The tarrasque is immune to all magical attacks, except those using blast templates. On a roll of 1 or 2 on a d6, any non-blast template attack is deflected back to the caster at full force.
  • Fear (−4): Anyone who sees the terrifying tarrasque must make a Fear check at −4.
  • Fearless: Tarrasques are immune to Fear and Intimidation.
  • Hyper Fast Regeneration: Tarrasques may attempt two natural healing rolls every round, even if Incapacitated, until they're slain.
  • Immunity: Acid, disease, Energy Drain, fire, lower Trait, paralysis, poison, puppet, Rending, shape change, Stun.
  • Low Light Vision: Tarrasques ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.
  • Powerful Leaper: +4 to Athletics (jumping) rolls.
  • Size 13 (Gargantuan): Tarrasques can reach up to 90' tall and weigh more than 30 tons. They can take three extra Wounds.
  • Speed: d10 running die.
  • Spines: A tarrasque may fire a spine from its tail as an action (Range 15/30/60, Damage Str+d6, AP 2).
  • Swallow Whole: Anyone hit by a bite attack must make an Evasion roll or be Swallowed Whole. The victim suffers one Wound at the end of his turn from the crushing gullet and acidic bile.

    If the creature is Shaken or Wounded from the inside (ignoring its Armor!), everyone inside gets an immediate Athletics roll to escape. If the tarrasque is Shaken or Wounded from the outside, everyone inside gets an Athletics roll at –2 to escape.

    Appropriate Tests (GM's call, such as pepper in the nose, extreme nausea from a spell effect or poison, etc.) might cause the beast to cough, sneeze, or vomit. This gives everyone inside an Athletics roll to escape.

  • Unstoppable: Tarrasques can’t suffer more than one Wound from a single attack (after soak rolls are made).

Languages: Aklo (can't speak).

Slithering like a large snake, this creature has the head of a dragon and a pair of clawed arms to help with movement and grappling. A sickly green mists wafts from its open maw.

Tatzlwryms spend most of their time lying in wait for prey, whether animal or humanoid. They hoard the remains of their hunts even though they have no use for the treasure. The eldest accumulate morbid troves of bones, debris, and valuables. These creatures often dwell in dense forests or underground caverns. They are known to favor Darkwood forests, in particular.

Type: Neutral Dragon (Tatzlwyrm)

  • Immunity: Slumber, stun.

The victim is automatically Shaken by the poison and must make a Vigor roll. Failure means the victim is Incapacitated for 2d6 rounds, or twice that with a Critical Failure.
  • Pounce: The wyrm pounces on its prey to best bring its mass and claws to bear. If a tatzlwyrm makes a Wild Attack, it adds +4 to its damage instead of +2.

The plant creature’s thick trunk is capped by a crown of wide leaves, whipping vines, mushrooms, and a ravenous purple maw. It is a voracious and dangerous hunter, preferring to ambush prey.

This monster looks something like a leathery, eyeless squid with a squat body the size of a rain barrel. Its lower body splits into a tangle of tentacles the creature uses to slowly move. Meanwhile, two longer tentacles—one thick and muscular, the other lithe and tipped with a bone stinger—emerge from either side of its upper body.

Tentamorts live in marshes or in underground caverns near water sources. These patient predators usually wait for prey to come to them, relying on their poison and quickness.

Treant.name: Treant
Treant.text:
Treant

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Treant]{Link to Actor}

Treants are guardians of the forest and speakers for the trees. As long-lived as the forests themselves, they are slow and methodical in most things but formidable when compelled to fight. They excel at tearing down what others build and they have an inherent dislike of loggers.

Treants are primarily solitary creatures, although they occasionally gather to share information and reproduce. In grave and rare times, treants convene a moot, which may last for months on end.

These animated trees have knotted bark with vaguely humanoid features. They tend to resemble the species of trees most common in their woodland territories—from the jungles of Garund, to Fangwood Forest in Nirmathas, and the Verduran Forest in Avistan.

Type: Good Plant (Treant)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d6, Spirit d10, Strength d12+3, Vigor d12

Skills: Athletics d6, Common Knowledge d6, Fighting d10, Intimidation d8, Notice d8, Persuasion d6, Stealth d4 (+4 in forests)

Pace: 6; Parry: 7; Toughness: 14 (2)

Hindrances: Cautious

Edges: Brave, Iron Jaw, Iron Will

Special Abilities:

  • Animate Trees: A treant can animate two trees at a time, within 30” (60 yards), as a limited free action. The trees take one round to uproot, then can move at Pace 2. These Extras have the same attributes, Fighting die type, and derived statistics as the treant. If they move out of the treant’s range or become Incapacitated, they re-root themselves. The treant can also end the animation at will. The trees serve the treant loyally.
  • Armor +2: Bark skin.
  • Bash: Str+d6, AP 2.
  • Destroy Objects: Treants do double damage when attacking objects.
  • Environmental Weakness: Fire, slashing.
  • Plant: ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination; immune to paralysis, poison, puppet, slumber, Stun, doesn't sleep.
  • Size 4 (Large): A typical treant is usually 20-30’ feet tall, with a trunk 2 feet in diameter, and weighs 4,500 lbs. It can take one extra Wound.
  • Rock Throwing: Giants are exceptionally good at throwing rocks, and can even throw at Extreme Range. Damage Str+d12, Range 20/40/80, Heavy Weapon.
  • Trample: Str+d6.
  • Treespeak: Treants can speak with any plant. They always begin with a Friendly reaction from other plant life.
  • Very Resilient: Treants can take two wounds before they're Incapacitated.

Languages: Common, Sylvan, Treant.

Troglodyte.name: Troglodyte
Troglodyte.text:
Troglodyte

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Troglodyte]{Link to Actor}

Troglodytes are feral cave dwellers with scaly gray bodies like that of cave lizards. They are among the most populous denizens of the upper reaches of the endless caverns of the underworld, raiding the settlements of those who dwell above or below ground.

Troglodytes are one of the oldest of the intelligent peoples. Ruins found in some remote caverns testify to the fact that their empire was once among the largest in the world. At the dawn of recorded history, troglodyte civilization was generations ahead of other humanoids.

Type: Evil Humanoid (Troglodyte)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d6, Spirit d6, Strength d6, Vigor d6

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d6, Notice d6, Stealth d6

Pace: 6; Parry: 5; Toughness: 7 (2)

Special Abilities:

  • Bite/Claws: Str+d4.
  • Darkvision: Troglodytes ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Hardy: The creature doesn't suffer a Wound from being Shaken twice.
  • Stench: The first time anyone enters within 2” (four yards) of a troglodyte, they must make a Vigor roll or become Distracted as they are overcome by nausea.

Languages: Draconic.

Troll.name: Troll
Troll.text:
Troll

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Troll]{Link to Actor}

Trolls are large humanoids with greenish hide, sharp claws, and bestial faces. Their stooped posture belies their size—14 feet tall and 1,000 pounds—but doesn’t diminish their formidable presence.

Trolls regenerate quickly, unless the damage inflicted is fire or acid-based. They deliver powerful blows with their claws, though they are also capable of fighting with weapons.

The creatures dwell in the wild areas of the Inner Sea region, most commonly in northern Avistan. In most troll societies, the males are solitary hunters and wanders, while the females and children live in extended family groups.

Type: Evil Humanoid (Troll)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d4, Spirit d6, Strength d12, Vigor d12

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d8, Intimidation d10, Notice d6, Stealth d6

Pace: 6; Parry: 6; Toughness: 11 (1)

Edges: Sweep

Special Abilities:

  • Ancestry (Giant): Night Vision, Reach 1, Size 2, Swat.
  • Armor +1: Rubbery hide.
  • Bite/Claws: Str+d6, AP 2.
  • Fast Regeneration: Trolls may attempt a natural healing roll every round, even if Incapacitated, unless their Wounds were caused by fire or acid or they’re put to the torch afterward.
  • Rending: Victims Shaken or Wounded by a rending attack are bleeding and must make a Vigor roll as a free action at the beginning of their next turn. Failure causes one Wound and the victim must make another Vigor roll next turn. Success means the victim doesn't suffer a Wound, but must make a Vigor roll again next turn. A raise stops the bleeding and no further rolls are required from that attack. A successful Healing roll also stops the bleeding.
  • Very Resilient: Trolls can take two Wounds before they’re Incapacitated.

Languages: Giant.

Feral Troll: Vigor d12+2 (Toughness 12 (1)), Fighting d10 (Parry 7), First Strike.

Troll Brute: Strength d12+2, Fighting d12 (Parry 8), Counterattack

Unicorn.text:
Unicorn

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Unicorn]{Link to Actor}

Unicorns are fierce, intelligent creatures of the forest, noble beasts who keep their own counsel and typically appear only to defend their homes against evil.

They universally shun all creatures except for good-aligned fey, good-aligned humanoid women, and the woodlands’ native animals, though they may fight alongside other good creatures against common enemies. A typical unicorn is 8 feet long and 5 feet tall at the shoulder, weighing 1,200 pounds.

Type: Good Magical Beast (Unicorn)

Attributes: Agility d10, Smarts d6, Spirit d8, Strength d10, Vigor d8

Skills: Athletics d6, Faith d8, Fighting d8, Notice d6, Stealth d6, Survival d6

Pace: 10; Parry: 6; Toughness: 9 (1)

Edges: Arcane Background (Miracles), Frenzy

Powers: Healing, light. Power Points: 10.

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +1: Magical hide.
  • Horn: Str+d8, AP 1
  • Immunity: Empathy, puppet, Poison.
  • Innate Powers:Detect evil (per Paladin Class Edge), minor teleport (Greater Teleport, self).
  • Kick: Str+d4.
  • Night Vision: A unicorn ignores all penalties for Illumination.
  • Protection from Evil: Evil creatures subtract 2 from Trait rolls made to attack a unicorn.
  • Resilient: Unicorns can take one Wound before they’re Incapacitated.
  • Size 2: Unicorns are the size of large horses.

Languages: Common, Sylvan.

Centaur.name: Centaur
Centaur.text:
Centaur

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Centaur]{Link to Actor}

Legendary hunters and skilled warriors, centaurs are part man and part horse. These stoic people usually dwell on the fringes of civilization. Their skin is deeply tanned but similar to the humans who occupy nearby regions, while their lower bodies resemble the colorations of local horse breeds.

Aloof with other peoples and at odds even with their own kind, centaurs are only slowly coming to accept the modern world. While the majority of centaurs still live in tribes roaming vast plains or the fringes of eldritch forests, some have abandoned the isolationist ways of their ancestors to walk among the more cosmopolitan cities of Golarion.

Type: Neutral Monstrous Humanoid (Centaur)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d6, Spirit d8, Strength d8, Vigor d8

Skills: Athletics d6, Common Knowledge d6, Fighting d6, Notice d8, Persuasion d4, Stealth d4, Survival d8

Pace: 8; Parry: 5 or 6 (shield); Toughness: 11 (3)

Edges: Fleet-Footed

Gear: Longsword (Str+d8), javelins (Range 3/6/12, Damage Str+d6), chainmail (+3), small shield.

Special Abilities:

  • Ancestry (Centaur): Darkvision, Size 2, Kick (Str+d4).

Languages: Common, Elven, Sylvan.

Centaur Warrior: Vigor d10 (Toughness 12 (3)), Fighting d8 (Parry 6 or 7), are Resilient.

Centaur Chieftain: Strength d10, Counterattack.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.text:
Vampire Weaknesses

  • Weakness (Garlic and Mirror): Vampires cannot tolerate the strong odor of garlic or the sight of mirrors and will not enter an area laced with it.
  • Weakness (Holy Symbol): A character with a holy symbol may keep a vampire at bay by displaying a holy symbol. A vampire who wants to directly attack the victim must beat her in an opposed Spirit roll.
  • Weakness (Holy Water): A vampire sprinkled with holy water is Fatigued. If immersed, he combusts as if it were direct sunlight (see below).
  • Weaknesses (Invitation Only): Vampires cannot enter a private dwelling without being invited. They may enter public domains as they please.
  • Weakness (Running Water): Each round of immersion in running water inflicts one Wound to a vampire—a vampire Incapacitated in this manner is destroyed.
  • Weakness (Sunlight): Exposing any vampire to direct sunlight causes it to suffer one Wound each round. If Incapacitated, the vampire is utterly destroyed.

Vargouille.name: Vargouille
Vargouille.text:
Vargouille

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Vargouille]{Link to Actor}

Originally from the lower @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{planes}, these creatures are grotesque flying heads with bat-like wings. Despite their otherworldly origins, they turn up on the Material Plane, especially in Andoran, Kaer Maga, and the Mwangi Expanse.

Typically, vargouilles lurk or lair near old battlefields, graveyards, or other locations visited by death. Evil spellcasters summon these creatures to Golarion from time to time. Their putrid kiss transforms their victims into vargouilles.

Type: Evil Outsider (Vargouille)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d4, Spirit d6, Strength d6, Vigor d8

Skills: Athletics d10, Fighting d6, Intimidation d6, Notice d6, Stealth d6, Survival d6

Pace: —; Parry: 5; Toughness: 6 (2)

Edges: —

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +2: Leathery hide.
  • Bite: Str+d4.
  • Darkvision: Vargouilles ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Flight: Pace 12.
  • Kiss: A vargouille can kiss a Stunned, unconscious, or otherwise helpless target. Anyone kissed must make a Vigor roll at –2. If failed, the victim goes bald over the next 24 hours, her skin becomes leathery, and she sprouts tentacles on her face (she has the Ugly (Major) Hindrance). After the second day, the transformation becomes lethal—she dies and her head pops off and flies away! Every six hours during the transformation process, she can make another Vigor roll. A successful roll pauses the transformation for a day, or two with a raise. It can be cured using healing with Greater Healing at a –2 on the casting roll.
  • Shriek: As a limited action, a vargouille can shriek. Non-vargouilles within 10" (20 yards) must make a Vigor roll or be Stunned.
  • Size –2 (Small): A vargouille is a flying head.

Languages: Infernal.

Violet Fungus.name: Violet Fungus
Violet Fungus.text:
Violet Fungus

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Violet Fungus]{Link to Actor}

This human-sized fungus grows from a bed of tentacular roots. Deep violet tendrils slither out of the dozens of fissures in its pointed cap. It is usually found in a small grove of up to a dozen fungi.

The carnivorous violet fungus is one of the most notorious and feared dangers of Golarion’s Darklands. It feeds on the rot and decay of organic matter. A violet fungus’s tendrils are coated with a virulent @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{venom}. These plants can move, but they usually stay rooted in one place as long as they have rotting organic matter to sustain them.

Type: Neutral Plant (Violet Fungus)

Attributes: Agility d4, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d6, Strength d6, Vigor d8

Skills: Fighting d6, Notice d6

Pace: 2; Parry: 5; Toughness: 9 (3)

Edges: —

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +3: Dense fibrous hide.
  • Plant: ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination; immune to paralysis, poison, puppet, slumber, Stun; doesn't sleep.
  • Rot: A victim Shaken or Wounded by the plant’s tentacles must make a Vigor roll to resist the effects of rot (–2 with a raise on the attack). Failure means one of the victim’s limbs rots away. This is a permanent Injury. Any successful healing effect within one hour stops the rot and saves the limb.
  • Tentacles (2): A violet fungus has two tentacle actions and Reach 1. It may lash with its tentacles for Str+d4 damage. Bound or Entangled prey may be bitten as usual.

Wight.name: Wight
Wight.text:
Wight

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Wight]{Link to Actor}

Wights are animated corpses, resembling a cross between ghouls and spectres. Their eyes burn with hatred, and they have a hunger for the souls of the living. For some, earthly desires or material bonds cause their spirits to remain behind to guard a treasure or their place of death. Others serve whomever brought them to unlife. Wights are sometimes found underwater, in caves or shipwrecks.

Type: Evil Undead (Wight)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d6, Spirit d8, Strength d6, Vigor d8

Skills: Athletics d8, Fighting d8, Intimidation d10, Notice d6, Stealth d8

Pace: 6; Parry: 6; Toughness: 10 (2)

Edges: —

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +2: Leathery dried skin.
  • Claws: Str +d4.
  • Energy Drain: Anyone Shaken or Wounded by a wight’s claws, suffers Energy Drain (Vigor). A Vigor roll (at –2 with a raise on the attack) resists this effect.
  • Fearless: Wights are immune to Fear and Intimidation.
  • Infection: Anyone slain by these undead raise as a wight one round later.
  • Undead: +2 Toughness; +2 to recover from being Shaken; no additional damage from Called Shots; ignores 1 point of Wound penalties; doesn’t breathe; immune to disease and poison; ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.

Languages: Common.

Will-o’-Wisp.name: Will-o’-Wisp
Will-o’-Wisp.text:
Will-o’-Wisp

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Will-o’-Wisp]{Link to Actor}

These strange aberrations live in swamps throughout Golarion, although no one is certain why they prefer such environments. Most commonly, they are encountered in the River Kingdoms, where they sometimes gather in small groups.

Will-o’-wisps appear as floating lights often mistaken as lanterns or beacons by travelers. The creatures attempt to lure such travelers into deep marshes and quicksand, or even to the lairs of other creatures. They do this in hopes of feeding on the fear of dying victims. They can deliver a shocking attack, but they prefer to feed on victims who can’t fight back.

Type: Evil Aberration (Will-O'-Wisp)

Attributes: Agility d12+2, Smarts d8, Spirit d8, Strength 1, Vigor d6

Skills: Athletics d12, Fighting d8, Notice d10, Persuasion d8, Stealth d10

Pace: —; Parry: 6; Toughness: 2

Edges: Alertness, Dodge, Level Headed

Special Abilities:

  • Darkvision: Will-o’-wisps ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Feed on Fear: Any time a will-o’-wisp is within 2” (4 yards) of an Incapacitated creature, or a creature that failed a Fear check, it becomes Resilient for 24 hours.
  • Flight: Pace 8.
  • Immunity: Magic.
  • Innate Powers: Major invisibility (self). Will-o’-wisps have the ability to extinguish their natural glow.
  • Size −3 (Very Small): Will-o’-wisps are 1’ in diameter.
  • Zap: Will-o’-wisps can make a Touch Attack for 2d6 electrical damage.

Languages: Aklo, Common.

Wolverine.name: Wolverine
Wolverine.text:
Wolverine

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Wolverine]{Link to Actor}

This muscular omnivore resembles a bear cub but smells more like a skunk. Known for its ferocity, a wolverine is often a solitary animal, though a male may have a few females in his territory.

Wolverines have thick, oily fur, and sharp crampon-like claws, perfect for climbing.

Type: Neutral Animal (Wolverine)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d6, Strength d8, Vigor d6

Skills: Athletics d8, Fighting d6, Notice d6, Stealth d4

Pace: 6; Parry: 5; Toughness: 5 (1)

Edges: Alertness

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +1: Thick hide.
  • Bite/Claws: Str+d4.
  • Hardy: A wolverine doesn't suffer a Wound from being Shaken twice.
  • Low Light Vision: Wolverines ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.
  • Rage: Wolverines go into a Rage when attacked (per the Barbarian Class Edge ability in Savage Pathfinder). The creature can't end its Rage voluntarily.
  • Size –1: Wyrmlings are small creatures.

Wolverine, Dire.name: Wolverine, Dire
Wolverine, Dire.text:
Wolverine, Dire

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Wolverine, Dire]{Link to Actor}

A dire wolverine is as large as a bear, its jaws and claws oversized and brutal, its eyes dark and filled with rage. Even more territorial than their smaller relatives, they defend their lairs to the death.

Type: Neutral Animal (Wolverine, Dire)

Attributes: Agility d10, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d8, Strength d10, Vigor d8

Skills: Athletics d10, Fighting d8, Notice d10, Stealth d4

Pace: 6; Parry: 6; Toughness: 9 (1)

Edges: Quick

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +1: Thick hide.
  • Bite/Claws: Str+d6, AP 2.
  • Low Light Vision: Dire wolverines ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.
  • Rage: Dire wolverines go into a Rage when attacked (per the Barbarian Class Edge ability in Savage Pathfinder). The creature can't end its Rage voluntarily.
  • Resilient: Dire wolverines can take one Wound before they're Incapacitated.
  • Size 2: Dire wolverines may grow to 12 feet long and weigh up to 1,000 pounds.
  • Stench: The first time anyone enters within 2” (four yards) of a dire wolverine, they must make a Vigor roll or become Distracted as they are overcome by nausea.

Worg.name: Worg
Worg.text:
Worg

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Worg]{Link to Actor}

These intelligent and evil creatures are a magical species of wolves. Larger than their animal cousins, they often hunt in packs, typically lead by an alpha worg who dominates the other members of the pack.

Unlike their cousins, worgs possess the power of speech —and guile. They sometimes make alliances with goblins and other evil humanoids.

Type: Evil Magical Beast (Worg)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d6, Spirit d6, Strength d10, Vigor d6

Skills: Athletics d8, Common Knowledge d4, Fighting d8, Notice d8, Persuasion d4, Stealth d6, Survival d6

Pace: 8; Parry: 6; Toughness: 6 (1)

Edges: Alertness

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +1: Thick fur.
  • Bite/Claws: Str+d4, AP 2.
  • Night Vision: Worgs ignore all penalties for Illumination.
  • Resilient: Worgs can take one Wound before they're Incapacitated.

    Languages: Common, Goblin.

Wraith.name: Wraith
Wraith.text:
Wraith

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Wraith]{Link to Actor}

Wraiths are undead creatures born of evil and darkness. They hate light and living things, as they have lost much of their connection to their former lives. The vile creatures appear as little more than dark shapes with two flickering pinpoints of light where their eyes should be.

Type: Evil Undead (Wraith)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d6, Spirit d6, Strength d8, Vigor d10

Skills: Athletics d8, Fighting d8, Intimidation d8, Notice d8, Persuasion d6, Stealth d6

Pace: —; Parry: 6; Toughness: 7

Edges: —

Special Abilities:

  • Claws: Str+d4, AP 2.
  • Darkvision: Wraiths ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Energy Drain: Anyone hit by a wraith's claws, suffers Energy Drain (Vigor). A Vigor roll (at –2 with a raise on the attack) resists this effect.
  • Ethereal: Wraiths can become invisible and immaterial at will and can only be harmed by magical attacks.
  • Flight: Pace 10.
  • Infection: Anyone slain by these undead raise as a wraith one round later.
  • Weakness (Daylight): A wraith caught in sunlight cannot attack and is Vulnerable.

Languages: Common, Infernal.

Cockatrice.name: Cockatrice
Cockatrice.text:
Cockatrice

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Cockatrice]{Link to Actor}

These small magical creatures look like featherless chickens with bat-like wings and reptilian tails. For those who encounter them for the first time, they seem harmless—and even a bit absurd—until their power of petrification makes itself known.

Fortunately, cockatrices are rare on Golarion, found primarily on the Whistling Plains on the eastern border of Taldor. Interestingly, cyclops are immune to the cockatrice’s petrification. The one-eyed giants domesticate these creatures as livestock.

Type: Neutral Magical Beast (Cockatrice)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d6, Strength d4, Vigor d6

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d6, Notice d8, Stealth d8

Pace: 5; Parry: 5; Toughness: 3

Edges: Dodge

Special Abilities:

  • Bite: Str+d4.
  • Darkvision: Cockatrices ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Energy Drain (Agility): A non-cockatrice hit by a bite attack (whether it causes damage or not) must make a Vigor roll or lose a die type in Agility (–2 with a raise on the attack). The victim is Incapacitated if this would reduce Agility below d4.
  • Flight: Pace 9.
  • Petrification: Anyone Incapacitated by the monster's Energy Drain is turned to stone and must make a Vigor roll. If failed, the victim cannot recover on her own. If successful, she regains a die type of Agility and is no longer petrified. Any other lost Agility returns one die type per day. Victims may also be restored with dispel at –2, but each caster may only try once.
  • Size −2 (Small): Cockatrices are 2’ tall and weigh 5 pounds.
  • Weakness (Roosters): For irrational reasons, cockatrices become infuriated by roosters. They are Distracted while in the presence of roosters, fighting their enemies or fleeing on a moment’s whim.

Wyvern.name: Wyvern
Wyvern.text:
Wyvern

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Wyvern]{Link to Actor}

Wyverns are two-legged dragons. They have no fiery breath, but possess long necks, sharp teeth, and a poisonous stinger in their tail.

Wyverns are territorial, aggressive, and impatient creatures. Unlike some of their dragon cousins, they have no interest in diplomacy or subtlety. They are quick to resort to force to accomplish their selfish goals.

Type: Neutral Dragon (Wyvern)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d4, Spirit d8, Strength d12, Vigor d10

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d10, Notice d10, Stealth d6

Pace: 5; Parry: 7; Toughness: 12 (2)

Edges: Frenzy (Imp)

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +2: Draconic scales.
  • Bite/Sting: Str+d6, AP 2.
  • Flight: Pace 8.
  • Immunity: Slumber, Stun.
  • Night Vision: Wyverns ignore all penalties for Illumination.
  • Poison (–2): The wyvern’s stinger contains a Mild poison.
  • Size 3: Wyverns are 16’ long, weighing nearly 2,000 lbs.

Languages: Draconic.

Xill.name: Xill
Xill.text:
Xill

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Xill]{Link to Actor}

Evil and alien, these flame-red humanoids are a strange mix of insect and reptile, with four arms and fanged mandibles.

Xills have only one purpose: to perpetuate themselves at the expense of others. All xills are female and capable of fertilizing their own eggs, but they require living hosts as incubators. A xill injects eggs into paralyzed victims via a grotesque ovipositor behind their mandibles. They prefer phase spiders as hosts.

Xills are the scourge of the Ethereal @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{Plane}. These plane-shifters possess impressive intelligence and a totalitarian, militaristic culture all their own. They sometimes come to the Material Plane to find hosts.

Type: Evil Outsider (Xill)

Attributes: Agility d10, Smarts d6, Spirit d6, Strength d10, Vigor d6

Skills: Athletics d10, Common Knowledge d6, Fighting d8, Intimidate d8, Notice d8, Occult d8, Shooting d8, Stealth d10, Survival d6

Pace: 7; Parry: 6 or 8 (shield); Toughness: 7 (2)

Edges: Ambidextrous, Quick, Two-Weapon Fighting

Gear: 2x short sword (Str+d6), longbow (Range 15/30/60, Damage 2d6, AP 1), medium shield.

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +2: Chitinous hide.
  • Bite: Str+d4.
  • Darkvision: Xills ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Extra Arms: Xills may ignore 2 points of Multi-Action penalties each turn.
  • Implant: As a limited action, a xill can lay a clutch of eggs in a helpless living creature. The eggs hatch in 24 hours, at which point they begin to consume the host, causing Energy Drain (Vigor) once per hour. A successful healing with Remove Disease kills all of the eggs. A Healing roll at –2 removes the eggs. Failure causes Fatigue. A critical failure causes a Wound.
  • Innate Powers: Major plane shift (self, Ethereal plane only).
  • Paralysis: Anyone Shaken or Wounded by a xill's bite must succeed at a Vigor roll or be paralyzed.

Languages: Common, Infernal.

Xorn.name: Xorn
Xorn.text:
Xorn

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Xorn]{Link to Actor}

This squat beast is as wide as it is tall. Strangely symmetrical, a xorn has three arms, three legs, three eyes, and one huge mouth. It typically grows to 8 feet in height, but older and larger specimens exist.

Xorns are outsiders from the elemental @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{plane} of Earth. They travel to Golarion’s Darklands to find and eat precious metals and gemstones. Xorns have little interest in native species, unless they happen to carry favorite meals. Xorns are known to accept bribes to avoid a fight or to provide temporary aid underground.

Xorn elders and leaders often have @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Class Abilities]{Class Edges}. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Rogue]{Rogue} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Barbarian]{Barbarian} are most common.

Type: Neutral Outsider (Xorn)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d6, Spirit d8, Strength d10, Vigor d10

Skills: Athletics d4, Fighting d8, Intimidate d8, Notice d10, Stealth d8, Survival d8

Pace: 4; Parry: 6; Toughness: 13 (5)

Edges: Combat Reflexes, Counterattack, Iron Jaw

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +5: Stone flesh.
  • Bite/Claws: Str+d6, AP 2.
  • All-Around Vision: Xorns can see in all directions. They ignore 1 point of Gang Up bonuses.
  • Burrow (4”): Xorns can glide through any natural earth or stone as easily as a fish swims through water.
  • Darkvision: Xorns ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Environmental Resistance: Electricity.
  • Immunity: Cold, fire.
  • Resilient: Xorns can take one Wound before they're Incapacitated.
  • Size 1: Xorn can grow to 8’ tall.

Languages: Terran.

Yeth hound.name: Yeth hound
Yeth hound.text:
Yeth hound

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Yeth hound]{Link to Actor}

These emaciated creatures resemble canines, though they originate from the lower @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{planes}. More importantly, the strange hounds have magical powers, including the ability to fly.

Yeth Hounds sometimes serve evil humanoids or other masters, such as demons. They travel in pairs or wander in packs in the darkest parts of Golarion, such as the Anferita Wood of Cheliax.

Type: Evil Outsider (Yeth Hound)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d6, Strength d6, Vigor d8

Skills: Athletics d8, Fighting d8, Notice d8, Stealth d6

Pace: 7; Parry: 6; Toughness: 9 (3)

Edges: Alertness

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +3: Outsider hide.
  • Bay: As a limited action, a yeth hound can let out a terrible howl. All creatures except evil outsiders within 100 yards must make a Spirit roll or become Panicked.
  • Bite: Str+d4.
  • Darkvision: Yeth hounds ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Environmental Weakness: Silver.
  • Flight: Pace 12.
  • Sinister Bite: Any non-outsider Shaken or Wounded by a yeth hound's bite must make a Spirit roll or become Distracted.

Languages: Abyssal or Infernal (can’t speak).

Yeti.name: Yeti
Yeti.text:
Yeti

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Yeti]{Link to Actor}

Large, white-haired humanoids, Yeti are sometimes called abominable snowmen, although it’s unclear whether that mythical label is accurate or a misnomer.

These intelligent, stealthy creatures live in mountain ranges across Avistan as well as the icy landscapes of the Crown of the World. Typically, they form small tribes but are rarely seen in groups—it is more likely to spot a solitary Yeti, who might easily evade any attempts to follow it.

Type: Neutral Monstrous Humanoid (Yeti)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d6, Spirit d8, Strength d10, Vigor d8

Skills: Athletics d10, Fighting d8, Intimidation d8, Notice d8, Stealth d6

Pace: 7; Parry: 6; Toughness: 10 (2)

Edges: Fast Healer

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +2: Thick fur.
  • Bite/Claws: Str+d6, AP 2.
  • Darkvision: Yeti ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Environmental Weakness: Fire.
  • Frightful Gaze: Enemies that meet the gaze of one or more Yeti must succeed at a Spirit roll or be paralyzed.
  • Immunity: Cold.
  • Rage: Yeti go into a Rage when attacked. See the Barbarian Class Edge in Savage Pathfinder.
  • Resilient: Yetis can take one Wound before they’re Incapacitated.
  • Size 2: A Yeti stands around 9’ tall and weigh almost 1,100 lbs.

Languages: Aklo.

Zombie.name: Zombie
Zombie.text:
Zombie

These walking dead are typical groaning fiends looking for fresh meat. They come in various shapes and sizes, such as the following.

Animal zombie.name: Animal zombie
Animal zombie.text:
Animal zombie

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Animal Zombie]{Link to Actor}

This profile is for animal zombies smaller than humans.

  • Fearless: Zombies are immune to Fear and Intimidation.

  • Weakness (Head): Called Shots to a zombie’s head do the usual +4 damage.

Giant Zombie.name: Giant Zombie
Giant Zombie.text:
Giant Zombie

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Giant Zombie]{Link to Actor}

These stats are for zombie hill giants, although other giantkind may be animated for larger and stronger versions. Sometimes, giant zombies have weapons and hide armor (+2).

Type: Evil Undead (Zombie)

Attributes: Agility d4, Smarts d4, Spirit d6, Strength d12+2, Vigor d10

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d8, Notice d6, Stealth d4

Pace: 6; Parry: 6; Toughness: 11 (2)

Edges: Sweep

Special Abilities:

  • Bite/Claws: Str+d4.

Darkmantle.name: Darkmantle
Darkmantle.text:
Darkmantle

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Darkmantle]{Link to Actor}

These tentacled creatures cling to roosts in cave ceilings, room rafters, and the like. They often scavenge for food, but they also hunt in favorable conditions. They wait patiently in their perches, using their @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{darkness} ability before swooping down on prey.

Darkmantles are found in the Darklands, most commonly, although they may adopt a lair above ground in dark forests or ruins. Their names describe them—they look like cloaks with dark granite coloring that blends in with most natural surroundings.

  • Bite: Str+d6.

  • Innate Powers: Minor darkness (once per day).

Deathweb.name: Deathweb
Deathweb.text:
Deathweb

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Deathweb]{Link to Actor}

A deathweb is the husk of an enormous spider, inhabited by thousands of living spiders. Individually these are normal spiders of varying size. Together, they form an undead hive mind. They work together to swarm around the giant spider’s exoskeleton, weaving intricate web sheets and hunting prey. The hive’s Infestation ability poses a threat to any adversary.

Deathwebs lair in tunnels, caves, and dense woods—anywhere they can weave traps to capture prey for the multitude of vociferous spiders.

Type: Neutral Undead (Deathweb)

Attributes: Agility d8, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d8, Strength d12+2, Vigor d10

Edges: —

  • Bite: Str+d6, AP 2.
  • Darkvision: Deathwebs ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.
  • Infestation: A swarm of poisonous spiders, which nest within the exoskeleton, constantly surround a deathweb in a Medium Blast Template. Anyone starting their turn in the area must Evade or take 2d6 damage.
  • Poison (–1): The deathweb’s bite delivers a Lethal poison.
  • Size 2: The exoskeleton is 10 feet long.

Demons.name: Demons
Demons.text:
Demons

Demons come to the Material @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{Plane} from the Abyss. They are usually summoned by evil spellcasters as bodyguards or to complete some terrible mission. These irredeemably evil creatures have destructive and malicious tendencies. They sometimes do as they please, despite the reasons for their summoning.

Alligator-Crocodile.name: Alligator-Crocodile
Alligator-Crocodile.text:
Alligator/Crocodile

Alligators and crocodiles lurk in the wetlands of Golarion, usually freshwater but sometimes in brackish or saltwater. The statistics here represent an average specimen of either species. Much larger versions are often found in more remote areas.

Type: Neutral Animal (Alligator/Crocodile)

Glabrezu.name: Glabrezu
Glabrezu.text:
Glabrezu

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Glabrezu]{Link to Actor}

Ferocious and bestial in form, the glabrezu is a master of trickery and lies. These treacherous demons form from the souls of the treasonous, the false, and the subversive. That is, souls of mortals who, in life, bore false witness or used treachery and deceit to ruin the lives of others.

With its ability to cloak its true form in pleasant illusions, the glabrezu uses its magic to grant wishes to mortal humanoids as a method of rewarding those who succumb to its guile and deceit. A @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{Wish} granted by a glabrezu always fulfills the wisher’s need in the most destructive way possible—although such methods might not be immediately apparent.

Type: Evil Outsider (Glabrezu)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d8, Spirit d8, Strength d12+3, Vigor d10

Skills: Athletics d6, Common Knowledge d6, Fighting d10, Intimidation d8, Notice d10, Persuasion d8, Stealth d4

Pace: 7; Parry: 7; Toughness: 17 (5)

Edges: Arcane Resistance, Sweep (Imp)

Special Abilities:

  • Bite/Claws/Pincers: Str+d6, AP 4.

  • Grant Wish: Once per month, a Glabrezu demon can grant a mortal humanoid a wish.
  • Innate Powers: Minor confusion, minor dispel, minor illusion (duplicate of caster only) , minor teleport (Greater Teleport, self).
  • Rending: Anyone Shaken or Wounded by a bite attack begins to bleed profusely and must make a Vigor roll at the start of their next turn. Failure causes the victim to take a Wound. Success prevents the Wound but the roll must be made again on the victim's next turn. A raise or successful healing stops the bleeding.
  • Reverse Gravity: As a limited action, a glabrezu can place a Large Blast Template within 10” (20 yards). Anyone in the template who doesn't Evade falls upward 60 feet. If this causes them to hit a hard surface (such as a ceiling) they take damage as if falling. Anyone who enters the template after it's created falls upward automatically. The Duration is five rounds, but anyone who somehow manages to move out of the template falls and is no longer affected.
  • Size 5 (Large): Glabrezu demons stand 18’ tall and weigh 6,000 lbs. They can take one extra Wound.
  • Summon: As a limited action this creature can summon another glabrezu or two vrocks, once per day.
  • Swat: Ignores 4 points of Scale penalties.
  • Very Resilient: The glabrezu can take two Wounds before being Incapacitated.

Languages: Abyssal, Celestrial, Draconic.

Quasit.name: Quasit
Quasit.text:
Quasit

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Quasit]{Link to Actor}

These tiny, winged demons appear on the Material @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{Plane} as a result of an evil spellcaster’s attempt to summon a familiar. Usually, they serve a master, although free quasits are known to exist.

Succubus.name: Succubus
Succubus.text:
Succubus

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Succubus]{Link to Actor}

Among the demon hordes, a succubus can often rise to incredible heights of power via her manipulations and sensual charms. Many a demonic war has raged because of the subtle machinations of these demons. A succubus is formed from the souls of particularly lustful and rapacious evil mortals.

Type: Evil Outsider (Succubus)

A successful dispel removes the attribute increases and mind link.
  • Resilient: Succubi can take one Wound before they're Incapacitated.

Languages: Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic.

Vrock.name: Vrock
Vrock.text:
Vrock

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Vrock]{Link to Actor}

Profane champions of the Abyss, vrocks embody all the rage, hatred, and violence of that despicable realm. As ravenous and grotesquely opportunistic as the avian scavengers they resemble, vrocks delight in bloodshed, relishing the sounds and sensations of ripping the still-pulsing entrails from a living husk.

Vrocks usually form from the evil souls of hateful and wrathful mortals, particularly criminals, mercenaries, or assassins.

Special Abilities:

If a vrock performs the Dance of Ruin for two consecutive turns, it releases an explosion of energy. Every foe within 20” (40 yards) takes 2d6 electricity damage for each vrock that finished the dance. This can be Evaded for half-damage.
  • Darkvision: Vrocks ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”.

Devils.name: Devils
Devils.text:
Devils

Devils are evil outsiders from the nine layers of Hell. They seek to destroy all things good, on Golarion and elsewhere. Whether for sport or at the bidding of superiors, devils delight in dragging mortal souls to the depths of their home @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{plane}.

Many types of devils are known to scholars and occultists. Each of these masters of corruption­ specializes in unique forms of depravity or temptation. Devils are often summoned by evil spellcasters—and are quick to make devious bargains with the souls they intend to take. Ultimately their allegiance is always to the hierarchies of Hell.

Bone Devil.name: Bone Devil
Bone Devil.text:
Bone Devil

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Bone Devil]{Link to Actor}

These tall, withered skeletal devils have long bony tails ending in a wicked barbed stinger. They are the interrogators and inquisitors of devilkind. As such they enforce the infernal order and the will of the archdevils.

Fearsome opponents, they possess several magical abilities, as well as flight and a poisonous sting.

Special Abilities:

  • Bite/Claws/Sting: Str+d4, AP 2.

Ice Devil.text:
Ice Devil

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Ice Devil]{Link to Actor}

Ice devils are monstrous humanoid insects, and the strategic geniuses of Hell’s armies. They prefer to let their minions engage in melee while supporting them with their powers and other abilities, but are dangerous foes in combat in their own right.

  • Resilient: Ice devils can take one Wound before they're Incapacitated.
  • Size 2: Ice devils are 12’ tall and weigh approximately 700 lbs.
  • Slow: A hit from an ice devil's tail or spear induces numbing cold. The opponent must make a Spirit roll at –2 or be affected by sloth (A raise on the attack is also raise on the sloth effect).
  • Summon: Once per day as a limited action, this creature can summon a bone devil.

    • Languages: Celestial, Common, Draconic, Infernal.

Lemure.name: Lemure
Lemure.text:
Lemure

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Lemure]{Link to Actor}

The least of devilkind, lemures are shapeless masses of quivering flesh. These tortured souls bear little resemblance to whatever they once were. A malformed face and knobby limbs provide the only hint of their existence before being damned to Hell.

After suffering for ages, some souls are transformed into lemures. Greater devils can spot the most corrupt lemures, reshaping them into true devils to serve obediently in the legions of the damned.

Type: Evil Outsider (Lemure)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d6, Strength d6, Vigor d6

Skills: Fighting d4, Notice d4

Edges: —

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +2: Goopy skin.
  • Claws: Str.
  • Devil: Ignore penalties for Illumination up to 10”; +4 damage from silvered weapons; –4 damage from acid, cold; immune to fire, poison.
  • Mindless: Immune to puppet, Intimidation, and Taunt.

Dog-Wolf.name: Dog-Wolf
Dog-Wolf.text:
Dog/Wolf

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Dog/Wolf]{Link to Actor}

Animated Object.name: Animated Object
Animated Object.text:
Animated Object

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Animated Object]{Link to Actor}

An animated object is not simply one monster, but a whole category. These constructs are created by powerful spellcasters as servants and guardians. The @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{size} and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore08bestia.JournalEntryPage.08specialabili00]{abilities} of an animated object varies wildly.

Type: Neutral Construct (Animated Object)

Attributes: Agility d6, Smarts d4 (A), Spirit d6, Strength d6, Vigor d6

Skills: Athletics d6, Fighting d6, Notice d8, Stealth d8

Pace: 6; Parry: 5; Toughness: 7 (2)

Edges: —

Special Abilities:

  • Armor +2: Sturdy construction.
  • Bash: Str+d6.
  • Construct: +2 to recover from being Shaken; ignores 1 point of Wound penalties; doesn't breathe or suffer from disease or poison.
  • Construction: Choose the size of the animated object. The animated object has a number of Construction Points equal to its Size+2.
  • Night Vision: Animated objects ignore all penalties for Illumination.

When creating an animated object, spend its Construction Points to give it Construction Abilities from the chart below. Each ability can only be taken once unless otherwise stated.

A GM can add additional abilities if they are trying to create a specific object.

Construction Abilities
One Construction point per ability

Additional Actions: The object can make two attacks each turn without suffering the two points of Multi-Action penalties.

Additional Movement: The object gains a new mode of movement (Aquatic, Burrow, Flight, or Wall Walker) equal to its Pace.

Augmented Damage: Increase the object's Bash damage one die type or increase its AP by 2. This may be taken up to three times.

Burn: The object deals an additional d6 (fire) damage on attacks. Anyone hit by this attack has a chance to catch on fire.

Constrict: The object can make a free grapple attempt when it hits a creature with a Bash attack.

Exceptional Reach: Increase the object's Reach by 1. This can be taken up to three times.

Faster: The object’s Pace is increased by 2.

Improved Construction: The object’s Armor is increased by 2.

Improved Trait: Increase one of this object's Traits by one die type or give it a new skill at d4. This can be taken any number of times.

Ranged Attack: Replace the Bash attack with a ranged attack (Range 6/12/24) with the same damage as the Bash it replaced. This object uses Athletics (throwing) for this attack.

Resilient/Very Resilient: This object is Resilient. If taken a second time it is Very Resilient.

Trample: This object gains the Trample Ability. An object must be Size 4 or larger to take this.

Doppelganger.name: Doppelganger
Doppelganger.text:
Doppelganger

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Doppelganger]{Link to Actor}

These strange beings take the shape and abilities of other humanoids. Accomplished mimics, they often live among human communities without ever revealing their true form. Their abilities make them excellent spies and assassins; they sometimes ally themselves with powerful authorities, serving until it no longer suits their whim.

Doppelgangers revert to their natural form when killed. They can also assume their natural appearance at will, with a fearsome effect. They appear as slender humans with hairless gray skin, bulbous eyes and long arms. Their nebulous facial features give the impression of a creature not yet fully-formed.

Languages: Common.

Archons

Archons are outsiders from the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{plane} of Heaven. As creatures of Good and law, they are tasked with the protection of Heaven as well as all who are innocent or free of evil.

Archons are the natural enemies of devils and demons. Most are veterans of many attacks against their home plane by fiends of the Lower @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{Plane}.

Each archon begins as a lantern archon or lesser servitor spirit. They gain power and prestige through their efforts to aid the cause of Good. This includes time on the Material Plane, where they often take on the roles of questing knights or other champions, aiding mortals in good works and promoting courageous acts.

Any hostile being within 3" (6 yards) must make a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Spirit roll}. Those who fail subtract 1 from all Trait rolls for the next 24 hours, or until they successfully @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shake or Wound} the archon that caused the condition. Dragon Turtle

@Compendium[swpf-bestiary.swpf-bestiary.Dragon Turtle]{Link to Actor}

This massive aquatic creature resembles an unlikely cross between a dragon and a common snapping turtle. Their giant shells vary in color, like their dragon namesakes. An average specimen grows to 25 feet long, from their head to their dragon-like tails.

Dragon turtles inhabit both fresh and salt water, making their lairs in vast underwater caverns. Usually solitary creatures, they claim large territories as their own, hunting large fish and posing threats to shipping routes. They are known to roam the western seas of the Shackles, the waters near the Devil’s Drain, and the Embaral Ocean.

Dragon turtles have powerful teeth and claws, a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Breath Weapons]{breath weapon}, and a natural ability to capsize naval vessels. Sailors have learned to offer gifts to ensure safe passage on the waterways ruled by these aquatic dragons—who have come to expect such tithes.
